title: The Power of Persistence
content: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston S. Churchill

title: On Innovation
content: Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower.
author: Steve Jobs

title: The Essence of Life
content: The unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates

title: Embrace the Journey
content: The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
author: Lao Tzu

title: On Character
content: Watch your thoughts; they become words. Watch your words; they become actions. Watch your actions; they become habits. Watch your habits; they become character. Watch your character; it becomes your destiny.
author: Lao Tzu

title: The Future Belongs to the Curious
content: The important thing is not to stop questioning. Curiosity has its own reason for existence.
author: Albert Einstein

title: On Resilience
content: It is impossible to live without failing at something, unless you live so cautiously that you might as well not have lived at all - in which case, you have failed by default.
author: J.K. Rowling

title: The Power of Belief
content: Whether you think you can, or you think you can't – you're right.
author: Henry Ford

title: On Happiness
content: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
author: Dalai Lama XIV

title: The Value of Time
content: Lost time is never found again.
author: Benjamin Franklin

title: On Learning
content: Tell me and I forget. Teach me and I remember. Involve me and I learn.
author: Benjamin Franklin

title: The Importance of Action
content: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
author: Peter Drucker

title: On Dreams
content: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.
author: Walt Disney

title: The Nature of Reality
content: We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are.
author: Anaïs Nin

title: On Leadership
content: A leader is one who knows the way, goes the way, and shows the way.
author: John C. Maxwell

title: The Power of Imagination
content: Imagination is more important than knowledge. For knowledge is limited, whereas imagination embraces the entire world, stimulating progress, giving birth to evolution.
author: Albert Einstein

title: On Perseverance
content: Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.
author: Thomas A. Edison

title: The Secret to Getting Ahead
content: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

title: On Change
content: The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.
author: Alan Watts

title: On Self-Reliance
content: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

title: The Art of Living
content: Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans.
author: John Lennon

title: On Courage
content: Courage is not the absence of fear, but rather the judgment that something else is more important than fear.
author: Ambrose Redmoon

title: The Pursuit of Excellence
content: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
author: Aristotle

title: On Perspective
content: The world as we have created it is a process of our thinking. It cannot be changed without changing our thinking.
author: Albert Einstein

title: The Power of Dreams
content: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
author: C.S. Lewis

title: On Growth
content: Unless you try to do something beyond what you have already mastered, you will never grow.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

title: The Importance of Kindness
content: Kindness is the language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see.
author: Mark Twain

title: On Simplicity
content: Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

title: The Value of Experience
content: Experience is simply the name we give our mistakes.
author: Oscar Wilde

title: On Creativity
content: Creativity is intelligence having fun.
author: Albert Einstein

title: On Purpose
content: The purpose of life is not to be happy. It is to be useful, to be honorable, to be compassionate, to have it make some difference that you have lived and lived well.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

title: The Power of Now
content: The only moment that matters is now.
author: Eckhart Tolle

title: On Wisdom
content: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

title: The Importance of Self-Care
content: You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.
author: Buddha

title: On Integrity
content: The supreme quality for leadership is unquestionably integrity. Without it, no real success is possible, no matter whether it is on a section gang, a football field, in an army, or in an office.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

title: On Creativity and Intelligence
content: Creativity is intelligence having fun.
author: Albert Einstein

title: On the Value of Experience
content: Experience is simply the name we give our mistakes.
author: Oscar Wilde

title: On the Importance of Reading
content: The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go.
author: Dr. Seuss
references: I Can Read With My Eyes Shut!

title: On the Power of Words
content: Words are, of course, the most powerful drug used by mankind.
author: Rudyard Kipling

title: On the Value of Hard Work
content: The only place where success comes before work is in the dictionary.
author: Vidal Sassoon

title: On the Nature of Good and Evil
content: The line separating good and evil passes not through states, nor between classes, nor between political parties either -- but right through every human heart -- and through all human hearts.
author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

title: On the Importance of Listening
content: Most people do not listen with the intent to understand; they listen with the intent to reply.
author: Stephen Covey
references: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People

title: On the Beauty of Nature
content: Look deep into nature, and then you will understand everything better.
author: Albert Einstein

title: On the Power of Habit
content: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
author: Aristotle

title: On the Importance of Education
content: Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
author: Nelson Mandela

title: On the Nature of Happiness
content: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
author: Dalai Lama XIV

title: On the Value of Time
content: Lost time is never found again.
author: Benjamin Franklin

title: On the Importance of Action
content: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
author: Peter Drucker

content: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.
author: Walt Disney

content: We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are.
author: Anaïs Nin

content: Words are, of course, the most powerful drug used by mankind.
author: Rudyard Kipling

content: The only place where success comes before work is in the dictionary.
author: Vidal Sassoon

author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

author: Stephen Covey

author: Albert Einstein
